title: If we are holograms does that mean we are spirits? - Quora

response.answer_text: Think a bit about the following: For ghosts/spirits to be able to exist, the requirement must be that human life throughout the world follows exactly the same patterns: From birth to death, from death to some kind of afterlife and from this afterlife to rebirth. But: Unfortunately, this is not how the world, with its approx 4,300 more or less different religions is designed. which all contain a formula for birth, life, death and then the disagreement begins, for what happens when we die? E.g. If you just study the path of the Jews, Christians and Hindus after death, you will find that these explanations of what happens after death cannot be compared.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Reginald Cristofer Rogoff

response.answer_text: Souls or spirits are not holograms. We are fragments of The Intelligent Designer. In a sense we are fractals of Her but only in the context that we contain the evolutionary blueprint that She had, not that we are actual holograms. Paul Richard's answer to If God does exist, why doesn't God appear and seem to be silent to us? What does all this mean?
